intro: Manulea foliolosa, commonly known as the leafy manulea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Manulea foliolosa is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
